p: The compatibility between cellulose and other hydrophobic biopolymers could be remarkably enhanced by the amphiphilic lignin with polar phenolic OH and non-polar hydrocarbon groups [ 34]. Therefore, lignin is a potential component for bio-compatibilizer [ 4, 64]. The addition of lignin could improve the compatibility between cellulose and matrix as shown by scanning electron microscope (SEM) investigations.
